title: The "Ban words" system should be aware of location specific meanings
body:
I just stumbled upon this on euw server
and realised that .... the system is not very clever.

basically , not every language is supported by riot games
and that person is danish.

i agree that KYS is an acronym used in league of legends to ask people to kill themselves, however , it should be a contextualized ban nonetheless.

in that Very specific case
-----------------------------------------------------------
#This is what is said :
[16:00] [All] [removed] (LeBlanc): men jeg skal have noget guld for at få mad
[17:04] [All] [removed]  (LeBlanc): taaak tak
[17:46] [All] [removed] (LeBlanc): kys kys til dig smukke
[18:10] [All] [removed]  (LeBlanc): <3
-----------------------------------------------------------
#This is what the bot understood :
[16:00] [All] [removed]  (LeBlanc): men [?] have [?] for at [?] mad
[17:04] [All] [removed]  (LeBlanc): [?]
[17:46] [All] [removed] (LeBlanc): kys kys [?]
[18:10] [All] [removed]  (LeBlanc): <3
----------------------------------------------------------
#This is what google translate understood :
[16:00] [All] [removed]  (LeBlanc): but I need some gold to get fed
[17:04] [All] [removed]  (LeBlanc): Yeees Yes
[17:46] [All] [removed]  (LeBlanc): kiss kiss to you beautiful
[18:10] [All] [removed]  (LeBlanc): <3
---------------------------------------------------------
#This is what riot will try to prove happened
[16:00] [All] [removed]  (LeBlanc): Stop feeding r%%%%%
%%%%%04] [All] [removed]  (LeBlanc): Fuck you
[17:46] [All] [removed]  (LeBlanc): kys kys bitch
[18:10] [All] [removed]  (LeBlanc): ( è︿é)_╭∩╮
-----------------------------------------------------------

I know it is used by american (i mean English speakers in general , but more often north Americans) people as a very naughty sentence, but you're not gonna ban entire language from being spoken right 

also

https://i.imgur.com/eUiTuxJl.png

That's a big nono , a litteral 2 seconds google translate would have told you the opposite.

I mean , He could've lied about everything else
but you CANNOT deny other languages exist and are used.
this is actually xenophobic borderline racist, and quite Anglocentric.


also ,[ i invite you to go and take a look at the original thread.](https://boards.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behaviour-en/t54ElH5X-unjustified-baan-riot-wont-remove-it) , i'm not the original author, but i know there is a bigger chance riot will see it there


it's okay that the system banned him , statistically , i have no problem with that , i have problem with the fact that he remained banned anyway given the context.

Edit:
[So riot responded the magical "well , he had an unsportsmanlike behavior (which is quite large tbh) x games ago so he remain banned (even if h would NOT have been banned if their system was contextualized) "](https://imgur.com/8dQpnMo)

and anyway ,this answer should've never popped int he first place
system should be more aware of these things.

replies.body: I've removed the link and player's name. While the topic is fine, pulling a player's personal logs from one area they chose to post it and turning it into a case on another area without their buy-in is a bit too close to the **Name & Shame** rules for my tastes. The discussion is equally valid without this information.

Yeah sorry buddy :3

you forgot some of the text i removed it myself ;)

YEAH BROOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO
PUTTING A PLAYERS NAME IS AGAINST THE RULES, BUT TROLLING IN RANKED MODE ISNT
YEAH GOOOD JOB THE DJINN
WHAT DOES IT TAKE FOR YOU DOGS TO CHANGE RANKED?
YOUTUBERS, RIOT CASTERS ARE TELLING YOU RANKED IS RUINED, BUT HEY PLAYER NAMES MAN, PLAYERS NAMES ARE IMPORTANT.
Stupid dog.

> [{quoted}](name=regsinvit,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GMo5yu5Y,comment-id=00070004,timestamp=2019-08-29T21:16:20.628+0000)PUTTING A PLAYERS NAME IS AGAINST THE RULES, BUT TROLLING IN RANKED MODE ISNT

That is also against the rules. Simply because one thing isn't okay one place doesn't mean something else *is* okay in the other.

> WHAT DOES IT TAKE FOR YOU DOGS TO CHANGE RANKED?

As a volunteer moderator, I don't work on *League* or even for Riot, so I can't change anything. :)

This is like the 4th thread about this.

For fuck's sake, can people just **not** use KYS? I don't care what it means in Danish, what the translation is, or what he says he meant. Does anyone ACTUALLY speak like this?

> kiss kiss to you beautiful

No. He used KYS knowing exactly what it meant, and should be (and has been) punished for it.

So does kill yourself kill yourself to you beautiful
makes more sense ?

Also who sends hearts right after saying kill yourself ?

Seriously ?

> [{quoted}](name=The Anivia OTP,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GMo5yu5Y,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-08-27T17:39:51.198+0000)
>
> So does kill yourself kill yourself to you beautiful
> makes more sense ?
> 
> Also who sends hearts right after saying kill yourself ?
> 
> Seriously ?

Oh hell no! No you can't even speak your own language? Why the hell do we need to abide to this english language dictatorship

> [{quoted}](name=The Anivia OTP,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GMo5yu5Y,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-08-27T17:39:51.198+0000)
>
> So does kill yourself kill yourself to you beautiful
> makes more sense ?
> 
> Also who sends hearts right after saying kill yourself ?
> 
> Seriously ?

a lot of people, smilies too. people are r%%%%%s and thinks they are smarter if they use emoticons in they arguments/flames

**Riot does not support the Danish language in ANY region of League of Legends**.

As such, it does not **MATTER**. I can say that my native language of Hooplah uses the "n/f" words to mean something different. That doesn't mean it's acceptable in League.

If you are using a non-supported language that conflicts with the supported languages, that's your own problem.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GMo5yu5Y,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-08-27T18:13:38.194+0000)
>
> **Riot does not support the Danish language in ANY region of League of Legends**.
> 
> As such, it does not **MATTER**. I can say that my native language of Hooplah uses the "n/f" words to mean something different. That doesn't mean it's acceptable in League.
> 
> If you are using a non-supported language that conflicts with the supported languages, that's your own problem.

>If you're trans then thats your own problem

Completely different.

If you go to a foreign country, you are expected to follow their laws, regardless of the laws in your country. As a prime example, in Canada, marijuana is legal for medical *and* recreational use. You cannot cross the border with it or use it in the US.

Riot does not support the Danish language - thus the Danish language is not supported as a language for use in League of Legends. It is not at all feasible to have Riot trained in the thousands of languages spoken across the world just for these cases.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GMo5yu5Y,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2019-08-27T18:18:52.332+0000)
>
> Completely different.
> 
> If you go to a foreign country, you are expected to follow their laws, regardless of the laws in your country. As a prime example, in Canada, marijuana is legal for medical *and* recreational use. You cannot cross the border with it or use it in the US.
> 
> Riot does not support the Danish language - thus the Danish language is not supported as a language for use in League of Legends. It is not at all feasible to have Riot trained in the thousands of languages spoken across the world just for these cases.

the ban was over three letters

I'm pretty sure anyone can put those three letters in google translate and see what it means in danish.

You don't have to be a fluent speaker to be able to do that

And what if someone makes a claim that "my native language which isn't on Google Translate uses this word/phrase to mean something different"?

How is that fair to say "if your language isn't in Google Translate we won't consider it"?

Riot drew the line and the supported languages are very clearly stated.

Please mods, can we remove the “specialist” role from rujitra? All he does is argue and when proven wrong disappears. If he wasn’t responding, many of the conversations on player behavior would be calmer. I’ve been thinking this for a while.
Feel free to contact the mods on the offical Discord as I think chances are higher that someone responds to you there.

Dutch is definitely a well known language dude, are you actually trying to say that not only is Dutch an unknown language, but its his own fault that riot banned him for not understanding that he was speaking his native language, in the region which the language is a part of?

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GMo5yu5Y,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2019-08-27T18:18:52.332+0000)
> It is not at all feasible to have Riot trained in the thousands of languages spoken across the world just for these cases.

You are not supposed to support all the languages but just use the goddamn common sense and help people in situations like this. That's what a support is supposed to do, try to help people the best you can. A quick google translate would show you that the person didn't mean anything bad. If using google translate is too hard to use for your support then that just shows further more how incompetent of a company you are.

The problem is where does the line of "common sense" get drawn? How many native speakers does a language have to have to be "valid"? What do you do when someone complains about a dying language that they spoke as a kid with their parents and only a few hundred people in the world speak? Do you give them the "benefit of the doubt"? That's not fair.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GMo5yu5Y,comment-id=00030000000000010000,timestamp=2019-08-27T18:32:37.406+0000)
>
> The problem is where does the line of "common sense" get drawn? How many native speakers does a language have to have to be "valid"? What do you do when someone complains about a dying language that they spoke as a kid with their parents and only a few hundred people in the world speak? Do you give them the "benefit of the doubt"? That's not fair.

The reason KYS is banned automatically is because it's verbal abuse.  In contexts where no verbal abuse has occurred there should be no punishment as there is no victim and no crime.  I think that's an easy to qualify standard that's not just "common sense" and all it requires is the bare minimum effort on Riot support looking over the case and realizing their system is too sensitive.

Even if a language isn't supported, someone using every language is probably going to show up to your game.  If you're trying to maintain a positive play environment its in your best interest to minimize false positives over a simple misunderstanding.  Someone losing access to content they've paid, for even if Riot has the right to do so, is a big deal.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GMo5yu5Y,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-08-27T18:13:38.194+0000)
>
> **Riot does not support the Danish language in ANY region of League of Legends**.
> 
> As such, it does not **MATTER**. I can say that my native language of Hooplah uses the "n/f" words to mean something different. That doesn't mean it's acceptable in League.
> 
> If you are using a non-supported language that conflicts with the supported languages, that's your own problem.


this is a laugh come on now fella
it was a mistake, yeah there's no way around it, but he definitely didn't mean "kys" in our sense, and definitely meant kiss kiss. stop being so stead-fast, riot could at least unban the guy.

It's not a mistake.

Danish is not a recognized and supported language in League of Legends. It's no different than if I spammed the "n word" and then claimed "but in my language it means X".

Riot does not support Danish - just as Riot does not support thousands of languages that exist in the world. If you wish to discuss whether Riot should add more languages as officially supported ones, that's a different discussion. However, the player's ban was issued based on the officially supported languages for use in League of Legends - none of which have a meaning for the phrase the OP used other than the English one.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GMo5yu5Y,comment-id=000300010000,timestamp=2019-08-27T18:22:42.096+0000)
>
> It's not a mistake.
> 
> Danish is not a recognized and supported language in League of Legends. It's no different than if I spammed the "n word" and then claimed "but in my language it means X".
> 
> Riot does not support Danish - just as Riot does not support thousands of languages that exist in the world. If you wish to discuss whether Riot should add more languages as officially supported ones, that's a different discussion. However, the player's ban was issued based on the officially supported languages for use in League of Legends - none of which have a meaning for the phrase the OP used other than the English one.


Keep on ignoring what we're saying
We're saying we know that there's no way to avoid the ban from taking place
We're saying that given the correct context, riot should unban and wipe this from their account
How is this hard for you to understand? Why can't you say Riot should unban him?
You kinda remind me of those racist old white guys that get annoyed when people speak a different language in their country.

Where does the line get drawn then?

Let's say Riot permits Danish to be used as an excuse for this. Do they have to take **anyone** who is speaking some other language and allow them to break rules that apply to everyone else?

The line must be drawn somewhere. It was drawn before Danish as a supported language.

Well , if they fully speak danish in the sentence, what's wrong with it ?

that's the line , it cannot be simply this word , i agree, but at least , when the entire script is in danish, they would at least for once just google translate the sentence and see why they were wrong.

especially when happening on European servers.

Just as if any other banword is an actual word from another language , they could just take a look if it is actually the language used , it would take 2 minutes at most since 100% of the time they will receive a ticket and will have to answer anyway.

you wanna know what happen ? some idiot actually ment to say "killyourself" got banned because they were talking English all the way through,  i agree, but then this case where the person really spoke danish appeared , and they just treated him like the other cases, so they could go faster through their tickets.

it has happen , and may happen again.

if one day the french word gaule becomes an insult and a banword for riot.
should they ban me because idiot from all over the world decided to use it as an insult ?
That's why it is xenophobic and anglocentric
because if you're not english , you may not know what it's like when people all over the world don't acknowledge your language exist.

it's okay to not make the effort of speaking it (aka supporting it)
but admitting you cannot use it IS xenophobic, targeted at minorities, and that's just how racism works.

i'm lucky to be french and being able to use words i barely translate to make me looks like the pre-antepenultimate worst english speaker. but i can only empathize for that man who was taught a language and an entire company does not allow him to speak naturally in his own language with his friends.

Getting banned because other people are idiot is unfair.
He was speaking danish all the way through , admit it was in danish and then judge this case with a small translate just to see, he did not mean anyone else to get hurt.

the intent should be banned , not the action.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GMo5yu5Y,comment-id=00030001000000000000,timestamp=2019-08-27T18:26:56.991+0000)
>
> Where does the line get drawn then?
> 
> Let's say Riot permits Danish to be used as an excuse for this. Do they have to take **anyone** who is speaking some other language and allow them to break rules that apply to everyone else?
> 
> The line must be drawn somewhere. It was drawn before Danish as a supported language.

I didn't know saying "Kiss Kiss" is breaking riots tos
Danish is not a supported language. The term said was evaluated against the supported languages of the server.
LMFAOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO gottem

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GMo5yu5Y,comment-id=00030001000000000000,timestamp=2019-08-27T18:26:56.991+0000)
>
> Where does the line get drawn then?
> 
> Let's say Riot permits Danish to be used as an excuse for this. Do they have to take **anyone** who is speaking some other language and allow them to break rules that apply to everyone else?
> 
> The line must be drawn somewhere. It was drawn before Danish as a supported language.

the line gets drawn in context
he's being friendly, others are likely speaking danish since it's an interactive conversation, he says "kiss kiss to you, beautiful <3" 

again

why is it so hard for you to admit that riot misunderstood the situation (more specifically in the response) and this man deserves to be unbanned?

Riot did not misunderstand the situation.

Riot is not obligated to recognize any argument based on the usage of a non-supported language.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GMo5yu5Y,comment-id=0003000100000000000000000001,timestamp=2019-08-27T18:31:43.031+0000)
>
> Riot did not misunderstand the situation.
> 
> Riot is not obligated to recognize any argument based on the usage of a non-supported language.

Any normal company would try their best to help their customers and you are doing the exact opposite, you have this situation where you know the player is right but you won't help him "out of principle". How stupid is that? And almost every language for 99.9% of the players can be consistently translated using google translate and it's accurate enough to understand the context. You drew some imaginary line just because you are lazy and don't want to do a bit of extra work and go to google translate and try your best to help the people, which is not even taking that much time to do anyway.
So if I tell someone in-game "dræb dig selv", then that's not an offense?
Apparently not lol. Such a flawed logic.

then i can spam "din mor er en hakke, hun suttede pik i helvede" in chat ?

And i can also give a full danish tutorial on how to make nitroglycerin and it should be alright ?
I should also send government's secret in danish it will be alright ?
because it's in danish ?

That's is just being stupid , laws won't stop with language , not supported means they will make no effort in using the language, that's doesn't change the content
Ok , they might not have someone able to translate perfectly in danish , but they can at least admit the mistake(the incomplete system) has made a mistake(a ban) this time ?
not harm was intended at all in the entire conversation , and i don't see who would feel attacked by it.

It's like you're ignoring WHY we ban people in the first place...
Exactly. It's as though he's just incapable of abstract thinking. It's not even abstract, it's a simple concept but he doesn't seem to *WANT* to understand.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GMo5yu5Y,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-08-27T18:13:38.194+0000)
>
> **Riot does not support the Danish language in ANY region of League of Legends**.
> 
> As such, it does not **MATTER**. I can say that my native language of Hooplah uses the "n/f" words to mean something different. That doesn't mean it's acceptable in League.
> 
> If you are using a non-supported language that conflicts with the supported languages, that's your own problem.

Thats awesome. Thanks for this comment. 

Speak the designated language, simple stuff people.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

yeah of course , everyone speaks english, it's not like only 13% of the worlds population , especially in europe , where you have english people , irish people scottish people , and stranger scottish people right ?

english is the only language that matters

While what riot is doing to this poor guy is a load of bullshit,
i don't really see how can a bot be able to separate english from everything that is not english in a way that would be fullproof and impossible to trick.
... 
without installing the whole fucking google translate in their systems

edit:
Why am i even being downvoted?
i literally fully agree with the op

Ok they don't have to.

Guy sends in a support ticket and should be unbanned.

But that obviously didn't happen
